oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lawyers; Trials, litigation, etc.
Bryan, William Jennings, 1860-1925; Evolution and anti-evolution; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Jennings Bryan and his son, William Jennings Bryan, Jr, sitting in the courtroom of the Scopes Trial in July 1925. William Jennings Bryan, Jr. is sitting to the right of his father with his hand to his mustache.
William Jennings Bryan, Jr. was a successful lawyer practicing in Los Angles at the time his father enlisted his help by joining the Prosecution's team at the Scopes Trial.
